TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit CounterSample extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Defines a structure that holds the raw data for a performance counter.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of the CounterSample class to display data for a performance counter.
[!code-cpp[PerformanceCounterType.AverageCounter64#1](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.diagnostics.cou_2_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[PerformanceCounterType.AverageCounter64#1](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.diagnostics.cou_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[PerformanceCounterType.AverageCounter64#1](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.diagnostics.cou_2_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public CounterSample (long rawValue, long baseValue, long counterFrequency, long systemFrequency, long timeStamp, long timeStamp100nSec, System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterType counterType);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int64 rawValue, int64 baseValue, int64 counterFrequency, int64 systemFrequency, int64 timeStamp, int64 timeStamp100nSec, valuetype System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterType counterType) cil managed

Docs.param: The numeric value associated with the performance counter sample.
An optional, base raw value for the counter, to use only if the sample is based on multiple counters.
The frequency with which the counter is read.
The frequency with which the system reads from the counter.
The raw time stamp.
The raw, high-fidelity time stamp.
A object that indicates the type of the counter for which this sample is a snapshot.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure and sets the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample.CounterTimeStamp%2A> property to 0 (zero).

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to take an initial sample of the performance counter. The System Monitor supplies values for these parameters automatically when you call the <xref:System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounter.NextSample%2A> method for the first time.

MemberSignature.Value: public CounterSample (long rawValue, long baseValue, long counterFrequency, long systemFrequency, long timeStamp, long timeStamp100nSec, System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterType counterType, long counterTimeStamp);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int64 rawValue, int64 baseValue, int64 counterFrequency, int64 systemFrequency, int64 timeStamp, int64 timeStamp100nSec, valuetype System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterType counterType, int64 counterTimeStamp) cil managed

Docs.param: The numeric value associated with the performance counter sample.
An optional, base raw value for the counter, to use only if the sample is based on multiple counters.
The frequency with which the counter is read.
The frequency with which the system reads from the counter.
The raw time stamp.
The raw, high-fidelity time stamp.
A object that indicates the type of the counter for which this sample is a snapshot.
The time at which the sample was taken.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure and sets the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample.CounterTimeStamp%2A> property to the value that is passed in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to take samples after you have already taken an initial sample of the performance counter. The System Monitor supplies values for these parameters automatically when you call the <xref:System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounter.NextSample%2A> method.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to initialize a new <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample> structure, passing in values for the `rawValue`, `baseValue`, `counterFrequency`, `systemFrequency`, `timeStamp`, `timeStamp100nSec`, `counterType`, and `counterTimeStamp` parameters. After creating the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample> structure, the example displays the property values for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample> in the console window.
[!code-cs[CounterSample_Ctor_2#1](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/aeaaf99a-6fd9-427d-9d0d-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[CounterSample_Ctor_2#1](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/aeaaf99a-6fd9-427d-9d0d-_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[CounterSample_Ctor_2#1](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/aeaaf99a-6fd9-427d-9d0d-_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[CounterSample_Ctor_2#2](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/aeaaf99a-6fd9-427d-9d0d-_2.cs)] [!code-vb[CounterSample_Ctor_2#2](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/aeaaf99a-6fd9-427d-9d0d-_2.vb)] [!code-cpp[CounterSample_Ctor_2#2](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/aeaaf99a-6fd9-427d-9d0d-_2.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets an optional, base raw value for the counter.
Docs.value: The base raw value, which is used only if the sample is based on multiple counters.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example displays the value of the BaseValue property for a counter.
[!code-cpp[PerformanceCounterType.AverageCounter64#1](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.diagnostics.cou_3_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[PerformanceCounterType.AverageCounter64#1](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.diagnostics.cou_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[PerformanceCounterType.AverageCounter64#1](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.diagnostics.cou_3_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig float32 Calculate(valuetype System.Diagnostics.CounterSample counterSample) cil managed

Docs.param: The structure to use as a base point for calculating performance data.
Docs.summary: Calculates the performance data of the counter, using a single sample point. This method is generally used for uncalculated performance counter types.

MemberSignature.Value: public static float Calculate (System.Diagnostics.CounterSample counterSample, System.Diagnostics.CounterSample nextCounterSample);
.method public static hidebysig float32 Calculate(valuetype System.Diagnostics.CounterSample counterSample, valuetype System.Diagnostics.CounterSample nextCounterSample) cil managed

Docs.param: The structure to use as a base point for calculating performance data.
The structure to use as an ending point for calculating performance data.
Docs.summary: Calculates the performance data of the counter, using two sample points. This method is generally used for calculated performance counter types, such as averages.

Docs.value: The frequency with which the counter is read.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example displays the value of the CounterFrequency property for a counter.
[!code-cpp[PerformanceCounterType.AverageCounter64#1](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.diagnostics.cou_8_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[PerformanceCounterType.AverageCounter64#1](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.diagnostics.cou_8_1.cs)] [!code-vb[PerformanceCounterType.AverageCounter64#1](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.diagnostics.cou_8_1.vb)]

Docs.value: The time at which the sample was taken.

remarks.format:
